Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.collection

Interface IntList

All Known Implementing Classes:
IntArrayList
public sealed interface IntList permits IntArrayList (not exhaustive)
Yes, we have one, too, while we await Valhalla. Note that IntList is a sealed interface with just two implementations: one (IntArrayList) allows mutations on the list and the other is immutable. Instance of the immutable variant can only be obtained through the static factory methods on this interface.

    • size

      int size()
      Returns the current size of the list.
      Returns:
      The current size of the list.

    • isEmpty

      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns whether the list is empty.
      Returns:
      Whether the list is empty.

    • clear

      void clear()
      Clears the list. Note that this leaves the backing array untouched. It just resets the internal cursor.

    • trim

      void trim(int newSize)
      Trims the list to the specified size. Note that this leaves the backing array untouched. It just moves the internal cursor backwards.
      Parameters:
      newSize - The desired new size of the list (must be less than or equal to its current size)
      See Also:
      • setCapacity(int)

    • capacity

      int capacity()
      Returns the current capacity of the list (the length of the backing array).
      Returns:
      The current capacity of the list

    • setCapacity

      void setCapacity(int newCapacity)
      Resizes the backing array. The new capacity is allowed to be less than the current capacity, and even less than the size of the list. So this method can also be used as a truncate or a trim-to-size method.
      Parameters:
      newCapacity - The desired length of the backing array
      See Also:
      • trim(int)

    • toGenericList

      List<Integer> toGenericList()
      Converts this IntList to an unmodifiable List<Integer>.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable List&lt;Integer&gt;

    • toArray

      int[] toArray()
      Converts the list to an int[] array
      Returns:
      An int[] array containing the values in this list

    • stream

      IntStream stream()
      Returns an IntStream of the elements in this list.
      Returns:
      An IntStream of the elements in this list

    • forEach

      void forEach(IntConsumer action)
      Carries out the specified action for each of the elements in the list.
      Parameters:
      action - The action to carry out for each of the elements

    • forEachThrowing

      <E extends Throwable> void forEachThrowing(ThrowingIntConsumer<E> action) throws E
      Carries out the specified action for each of the elements in the list.
      Type Parameters:
      E - The type of the exception that the consumer is allowed to throw.
      Parameters:
      action - The action to carry out for each of the elements
      Throws:
      E - A (possibly checked) exception thrown from within the consumer
